item.title: Become part of the Content Collective
item.description: Have an eye for the latest TikTok trends? Comfortable on camera? Love creating and editing content? Want to get paid for it? If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

item.title: Save money on your postgraduate course with a scholarship
item.description: If you’re considering staying on at NTU for postgraduate study, there’s good news—funding support is more accessible than you might think.

item.title: Free tickets for Punch – NTU exclusive at Nottingham Playhouse
item.description: NTU Arts is delighted to offer free tickets to students interested in seeing Punch at Nottingham Playhouse.

item.title: Entries now open for the 2026 NTU Arts Creative Competition
item.description: Inspired by the book Queer as Folklore by Featured Writer Sacha Coward, NTU Arts is asking students to submit writing, music or images representing monsters, myths and magic.

item.title: Some of our online services will be unavailable on Thursday 12 February
item.description: Due to essential maintenance, there will be a scheduled break in some of our online services on Thursday 12 February between 6.30 am–9.30 am.

item.title: Live, Learn, Work: Riya explains how she has embraced ‘Work’
item.description: At NTU, learning is about more than a degree – it's about the person you become. We call this approach Live, Learn, Work.

item.title: It's time to talk
item.description: Today is Time to Talk Day, a chance for us to be more open about how we take care of our wellbeing.

item.title: Don't miss our NTU Brackenhurst Careers Fair
item.description: Meet a wide range of employers wanting to connect with NTU students and share their placement and graduate roles.

item.title: Stay safe online: new cyber security training now available
Get involved in LGBTQ+ History Month 2026: Celebrating science, innovation and community
item.description: Join NTU for wide range of events and activities designed to educate, inspire, and foster inclusivity.
